title: 2024_Championship_League_(ranking)
summary:
The 2024 Championship League (officially the 2024 BetVictor Championship League) was a professional ranking snooker tournament that took place from 10 June to 3 July 2024 at the Leicester Arena in Leicester, England. The event featured 128 players and was played as three rounds of round‑robin groups of four, before a best‑of‑five final. It was the fifth edition of the ranking version of the Championship League, and the first ranking tournament of the 2024‍–‍25 season.
Shaun Murphy was the defending champion, having defeated Mark Williams 3‍–‍0 in the final of the previous ranking edition of the tournament, but he was knocked out in Stage 2.
Ali Carter won his sixth ranking title, defeating Jackson Page 3‍–‍1 in the final. There were 95 century breaks made during the tournament, the highest being a 142 made by Wu Yize.

section_content.sentence: The 2024 Championship League took place from 10 June to 3 July 2024 at the Leicester Arena in Leicester, England
The tournament was organised by Matchroom Sport and sponsored by online gambling company BetVictor
128 players took part in the event
The competition began with 32 rounds of group matches with each group consisting of four players
Two groups were played to a finish every day using a two‑table setup in the arena
The groups were contested using a round‑robin format, with six matches played in each group
All matches in group play were played as best‑of‑four frames, with three points awarded for a win and one point for a draw
Group positions were determined by points scored, frame difference and then head‑to‑head results between players who were tied
Places that were still tied were then determined by the highest break made in the group
If the highest break was also tied, the next highest break made by the players was used
The 32 players that topped the group tables qualified for the group winners' stage, consisting of eight groups of four players
The eight winners from the group winners' stage qualified for the two final groups, with the final taking place later on the same day
The winner took the Championship League title and a place in the 2024 Champion of Champions
A number of top ranked players opted to miss the event, including world number one Mark Allen
Also former World Champions Judd Trump, Luca Brecel, and Mark Selby did not enter
There were 26 players not currently on the professional tour who were entered into the draw as follows:

The event was broadcast by DAZN in Germany, Spain, the United States and Brazil; Fox Sports in Australia; Nova in Czechia and Slovakia; Premier in the Philippines; Rigour in China; Viaplay in the Baltics, Iceland, and the Netherlands; Viasat in Scandinavia; and by Matchroom.live in all other territories
The breakdown of prize money for the tournament is shown below
Note: The champion receives a total of £33,000 (£3,000 + £4,000 + £6,000 + £20,000).
Stage one consisted of 32 groups, each having four players
Numbers in parentheses after the players' names denote the players' seeding, and (a) indicates amateur players not on the main World Snooker Tour
Order of play as follows:
Group 1 was played on 20 June
Scott Donaldson won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group A
Group 2 was played on 25 June
He Guoqiang won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group B
Group 3 was played on 27 June
The defending champion Shaun Murphy won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group C
Group 4 was played on 11 June
Mark Williams won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group D
Group 5 was played on 26 June
Ali Carter won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group E
Group 6 was played on 24 June
Gary Wilson won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group F
Group 7 was played on 17 June
Robbie McGuigan won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group G
Group 8 was played on 17 June
Jak Jones won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group H
Group 9 was played on 24 June
Ma Hailong won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group H
Group 10 was played on 14 June
Jackson Page won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group G
Group 11 was played on 10 June
Ryan Day won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group F
Group 12 was played on 25 June
Jack Lisowski won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group E
Group 13 was played on 21 June
Si Jiahui won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group D
Group 14 was played on 20 June
Hossein Vafaei won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group C
Group 15 was played on 27 June
David Gilbert won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group B
Group 16 was played on 26 June
Fan Zhengyi won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group A
Group 17 was played on 11 June
Chris Wakelin won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group A
Group 18 was played on 21 June
Stuart Bingham won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group B
Group 19 was played on 22 June
Long Zehuang won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group C
Group 20 was played on 22 June
Stuart Carrington won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group D
Group 21 was played on 10 June
Neil Robertson won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group E
Group 22 was played on 13 June
Joe O'Connor won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group F
Group 23 was played on 13 June
Michael White won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group G
Group 24 was played on 18 June
Martin O'Donnell won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group H
Group 25 was played on 12 June
Matthew Stevens won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group H
Group 26 was played on 19 June
Alexander Ursenbacher won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group G
Group 27 was played on 19 June
David Lilley won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group F
Group 28 was played on 18 June
Wu Yize won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group E
Group 29 was played on 15 June
Ben Woollaston won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group D
Group 30 was played on 15 June
Jamie Jones won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group C
Group 31 was played on 12 June
Ashley Carty won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group B
Group 32 was played on 14 June
Thepchaiya Un-Nooh won the group and advanced to Stage 2, Group A
Stage two consisted of eight groups, each having four players
Numbers in parentheses after the players' names denote the players' seeding
Order of play as follows:
Group A was played on 29 June
Scott Donaldson won the group and advanced to Stage 3, Winners' group 1
Group B was played on 28 June
David Gilbert won the group and advanced to Stage 3, Winners' group 2
Group C was played on 28 June
Long Zehuang won the group and advanced to Stage 3, Winners' group 2
Group D was played on 1 July
Mark Williams won the group and advanced to Stage 3, Winners' group 1
Group E was played on 29 June
Neil Robertson withdrew from the tournament and so the remaining three players faced each other twice
Ali Carter won the group and advanced to Stage 3, Winners' group 1
Group F was played on 2 July
David Lilley won the group and advanced to Stage 3, Winners' group 2
Group G was played on 2 July
Jackson Page won the group and advanced to Stage 3, Winners' group 2
Group H was played on 1 July
Martin O'Donnell won the group and advanced to Stage 3, Winners' group 1
Stage three consisted of two groups, each having four players
Winners' group 1 was played on 3 July
Ali Carter won the group and advanced to the final
Winners' group 2 was played on 3 July
Jackson Page won the group and advanced to the final
A total of 95 century breaks were made in the tournament, 64 in Stage 1, 23 in Stage 2, and 8 in Stage 3
